content: Taiwanese crispy, deep-fried dough of Hokchew originThis article includes a list of references, related reading, or external links, **but its sources remain unclear because it lacks inline citations**. Please help improve this article by introducing more precise citations. *(February 2013)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Shuangbaotai** ([simplified Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 双胞胎; [traditional Chinese](/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters): 雙胞胎; [pinyin](/wiki/Pinyin): *shuāngbāotāi*) is a sweet [fried dough food](/wiki/Fried_dough_foods) of [Hokchew origin](/wiki/Fuzhou_cuisine) commonly found as a [Taiwanese](/wiki/Taiwanese_cuisine) street food. It is a chewy fried dough containing large air pockets on the inside and a crisp crust on the outside. It is made by twisting two small pieces of dough together and frying them, causing them to separate slightly while remaining connected. ## Names The [Mandarin Chinese](/wiki/Standard_Mandarin) name of this food, *shuāngbāotāi* ([Chinese](/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters): 雙胞胎) meaning "[twins](/wiki/Twins)", is derived from the fact that the dish is two pastries twisted slightly together as if [conjoined twins](/wiki/Conjoined_twins). The [Taiwanese Hokkien](/wiki/Taiwanese_Hokkien) name is 馬花糋 (*bé-hoe-chìⁿ*), which roughly means "[horse](/wiki/Horse)-[hoof](/wiki/Hoof) cake", also in reference to its shape. Another Hokkien name is 雙生仔 (*siang-siⁿ-á*) meaning twins. ## Regional In [Taiwan](/wiki/Taiwan), shuangbaotai are a type of snack (*[xiaochi](/wiki/Xiaochi)*) typically sold by [hawkers](/wiki/Hawker_(trade)) at street stalls or in [night markets](/wiki/Night_markets), but not in regular restaurants or bakeries. - [Taiwanese cuisine](/wiki/Taiwanese_cuisine) - [Fuzhou cuisine](/wiki/Fuzhou_cuisine) - [Fujian cuisine](/wiki/Fujian_cuisine) - [List of desserts](/wiki/List_of_desserts) - [List of doughnut varieties](/wiki/List_of_doughnut_varieties) - [List of fried dough varieties](/wiki/List_of_fried_dough_varieties) - Food portal ### Other Chinese fried dough dishes - [Ham chim peng](/wiki/Ham_chim_peng) - [Ox-tongue pastry](/wiki/Ox-tongue_pastry) - [Youtiao](/wiki/Youtiao) - YTower — A famous maker of shuangbaotai (in Chinese) - Shuangbaotai Archived 2011-07-27 at the [Wayback Machine](/wiki/Wayback_Machine) at [Chiayi](/wiki/Chiayi) Tourism Bureau website — includes photos of shuangabotai (in Chinese) This [Taiwanese cuisine](/wiki/Taiwanese_cuisine)-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Shuangbaotai
